comments.body: Isn't it counter intuitive that the TNT that bounces, is called sticky. How about bouncy TNT instead.
Hmm. What about Rebound TNT?
That‚Äôs a billion different posts. I really like your ideas! Can we vote for all of the foods here or do we have to vote for them separately?
I like this idea... I‚Äôm not sure about the pole though, even if it is used for more things.

Having lots of Polearm weapons would be great! Weapons should be Split into different categories like Polearm, Sword, Bow etc. etc. Polearm weapons would be able to charge enemies (like a Trident with Riptide). You would also have the ability to hit enemies from further away than when using a Sword. The Spear would come in Iron, Gold, and Diamond variants dealing 1 damage point more than their Sword counterparts. I have a post about new weapons called Combat Update V2 that goes into more detail.
The spike should deal at least the same amount of damage than the sword

Here's the way I'd like to see lances be implemented.
Of course, to start there would be your usual tool tiers in wood, stone, iron, gold and diamond. The crafting recipe would require 3 materials for the head of the lance and 2 sticks diagonally: e.g. 2 sticks like a fishing pole, then 3 iron in the top middle, top right, and middle right.
The lance would be the longest range melee weapon in the game, about 5-6 blocks as opposed to the normal 3 block attack range. This way, lances would be the superior option for horseback as their long range would essentially negate the range loss from being on a horse. The attack power I see them having (in terms of the combat snapshots) is 1.8-2 attack speed and 8.5-9 attack damage for a diamond lance, putting them in a nice spot between axes and swords. I do think that if these were added then there would need to be some type of counter to horses, so I think the effective against horses/mounted players is a good idea (though maybe on a different weapon?). As for the heavy shaft enchantment, I also think that is a great idea, being able to extend attack range in place of using the offhand. It would also be cool to have a special thrusting animation for the lance rather than the normal swipe.
Categorizing weapons would be a welcome addition to the game as it would add lots of new combat strategies and make for lots of fun. I hope this gets added!

You dye wool by crafting 1 white wool with any other dye...
he means using coloured wool with another dye, to make a different coloured wool
How was it worded weirdly? I said dying any color to a different color. Such as dying black to white or blue to red.

I've seen this concept as a datapack (micro-mod) known as "Universal Dying". It let you do what you're suggesting and more. Like, it could do the same for any dyeable block like glass and concrete powder. And to remove the dye from an block, you would "dye" it with a block of ice? I think the logic is that ice is a sort of water source block. Like a water bucket without the bucket. Anyway, I also want this to be a feature in the vanilla game as it would increase creativity and would reduce wasted blocks. Voted!

I actually want this in game. They just added really hard to get armor and tools, so it's time for some stuff you can experience early on!

I dislike this idea; armor in Minecraft is too linear as it is. What I mean by that is that there is no real reason to pick anything other than full diamond armor, because it is the best armor type in practically every way. What you are proposing would make it even worse.
Some people don't wear chestplate for exemple, to have Elytra then the bonus will be gone.
It shouldn't give a bonus, maybe new armor types would be better.

It could actualy give purpose to other armors like example full leather armor could give you speed bonus and jump bonus and stuff and full gold armor could give you trade bonuses with villagers and enchantment bonuses at the enchant table or something. i dont know just an idea.
